CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 5, 1953, pg. 4, reads: "SUMMER TRAGEDY HERE - Pictured above (with arrow) is how 7-year-old Robert Cole of 502 Delmont Street plunged to his death last Friday in a summer tragedy in Beltzhoover district. Two other youngsters also fell when the banister they were sitting on collapsed, but they escaped with minor injuries.  Police immediately ordered the Born Real Estate Company of 233 Brownsville Road to barricade the porch until repairs could be made.  The railing which the youngster fell from was located were the new, white lumber can be seen.  The fire escape which two youngsters grabbed to halt their fall can also be seen in the picture, adjacent to the new railing."
TitMainTitle: Multi-story apartment building with fire escape and balconies, including one with broken railing, site of death of Robert Cole, 502 Delmont Street, Beltzhoover
